title: Klopp: We don't chase Man City, we try to win games
shortDescription: Jurgen Klopp insists Liverpool's focus remains solely on winning games, not chasing Premier League leaders Man City, whose advantage at the top was cut to three points.

title: England's Arnold Clark Cup victory: What we learned
shortDescription: After England Women were victorious in the Arnold Clark Cup, Sky Sports looks into the key learnings for Sarina Wiegman's side.

title: Papers: Lukaku won't rush decision on Chelsea future
shortDescription: All the top stories and transfer rumours from Wednesday's national and international newspapers...

title: Conte to talk to Spurs about future |
shortDescription: Antonio Conte has raised doubts about his Tottenham future after the 1-0 defeat to Burnley - and wants talks with the club. Watch his post match interview in full and then his later press conference.

title: Conte's stunning admission on future: 'Club will have to assess me'
shortDescription: Antonio Conte said Tottenham will have to make "an assessment" on his position in a stunning interview after a run of four defeats in five Premier League games.

title: Liverpool thrash Leeds to move three points behind Man City
shortDescription: Liverpool moved to within three points of league leaders Manchester City with a rip-roaring 6-0 win over Leeds at Anfield on Wednesday.

title: How Mitrovic broke the Championship scoring record
shortDescription: Aleksandar Mitrovic broke the record for the most goals scored in a Championship season when he scored twice in Fulham's 2-1 win over Peterborough. Here's how he did it.

title: Champ highlights, round-up: Blades, QPR win; Mitrovic breaks record
shortDescription: Ben Davies scored the winner as Sheffield United dented Blackburn's promotion bid, while Aleksandar Mitrovic broke the Championship scoring record on Wednesday night.

title: Liverpool hammer Leeds to close in on City
shortDescription: FREE TO WATCH: Highlights of Liverpool's win against Leeds in the Premier League.

title: Hodgson's Watford thrashed by Palace
shortDescription: FREE TO WATCH: Highlights of Crystal Palace's win against Watford in the Premier League.

title: Late goals see England beat Germany to win Arnold Clark Cup
shortDescription: Late goals from Millie Bright and Fran Kirby saw England Women beat Germany Women 3-1 at Molineux to win the Arnold Clark Cup.

title: Mitrovic breaks goals record as Fulham return to winning ways
shortDescription: Aleksandar Mitrovic broke the Championship record as Fulham extended their lead at the top of the table to nine points with a 2-1 win over Peterborough.

title: Huddersfield strike twice in late comeback win
shortDescription: Jonathan Russell scored a stoppage-time winner as Huddersfield completed a dramatic late comeback with a dramatic 2-1 victory over Cardiff.

title: Luton beat Stoke to maintain play-off surge
shortDescription: In-form Luton edged closer to the Championship play-off places thanks to a deserved 2-1 win at Stoke.

title: Penalty miss costs Blackburn as 10-man Sheff Utd grab late win
shortDescription: Sheffield United beat Blackburn 1-0 following a dramatic stoppage-time goal from substitute Ben Davies.

title: 10-man QPR strike late to get back on track
shortDescription: Luke Amos' last-minute goal gave 10-man QPR a dramatic 2-1 victory against Blackpool to boost their promotion hopes.

title: Millwall continue charge to dent Derby hopes
shortDescription: Millwall maintained their impressive record at Pride Park with a 2-1 victory to dent Derby's hopes of Championship survival.

title: Mee header boosts Burnley survival hopes
shortDescription: FREE TO WATCH: Highlights from Burnley's win against Tottenham in the Premier League.

title: Haller on target at each end as Benfica battle to draw with Ajax
shortDescription: Benfica came from behind twice to hold Ajax to a 2-2 draw in the first leg of their Champions League round-of-16 clash, with Sebastien Haller scoring for both teams.

title: Man Utd find a way but issues remain
shortDescription: Anthony Elanga rescued a 1-1 draw for Man Utd against Atletico Madrid but their performance showed the work ahead for Ralf Rangnick.
